body.p: When you execute the deploy process for a system, a copy of the builder files are stored on the following nodes and directories:

ul.li: On the Swift ring building node, the primary reference copy is stored in the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> directory.
On the next node after the Swift ring building node, a backup copy is stored in the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> directory.
In addition, in the deploy process, the builder files are also copied to the /etc/swiftlm/deploy_dir/region-<region-name> directory on every Swift node.

body.p: If a copy of the builder files are found in the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> then no further recover action is needed. However, if both the Swift ring building and next node are lost, then you need to copy the files from the /etc/swiftlm/deploy_dir/region-<region-name> directory from an intact Swift node to the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> directory on the primary Swift ring building node.
If you have no intact /etc/swiftlm directory on any Swift node, you may be able to restore from Freezer. See .
To restore builder files from the /etc/swiftlm/deploy_dir directory, use the following process:

ol.li: Log in to the Swift ring building server. To identify the Swift ring building server, see .

Create the /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir directory structure with these commands:
Replace <region-name> with the name of your region. sudo mkdir -p /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-<region-name> sudo chown -R stack.stack /etc/swiftlm/
Log in to a Swift node where an intact /etc/swiftlm/deploy_dir directory exists.

Copy the builder files to the Swift ring building node. In the example below we use scp to transfer the files, where swpac-c1-m1-mgmt is the ring building node and region1 is the region: scp /etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-region1/* swpac-ccp-c1-m1-mgmt:/etc/swiftlm/builder_dir/region-region1/
Log in to the lifecycle manager.
Run the Swift reconfigure playbook to make sure every Swift node has the same rings: cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts swift-reconfigure.yml
